ZzBot is your friendly task management assistant, designed to help you track deadlines, events, and todos with ease!
This will return all tasks containing the keyword 'book'.
### Note: This command simply outputs a farewell message. It is not meant to exit the program.
ZzBot has an outgoing personality. In every response, he will begin with a friendly "Certainly Bro!".
If you have trouble memorizing all the commands, simply use the command:
A manual will be displayed to guide you.
* The {@code Deadlines} class represents a task with a specific deadline.
* It extends the {@code Task} class and adds a {@code LocalDate} attribute to

* The task is initialized as not done.

public Deadlines(String name, boolean isDone, LocalDate deadline) {

* The {@code Task} class is an abstract class representing a general task.

* @return The status icon, "X" if the task is done, otherwise a blank space.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X

* The {@code ZzBot} class represents the core functionality of the bot,
* managing tasks and interacting with the user through a command-line interface.
* It supports adding, deleting, listing, and finding tasks, as well as marking tasks
* as done or not done. The bot also saves tasks to a storage file.

* Unit test for the {@link Deadlines} class.
* This test suite verifies the functionality of the Deadlines class,
* including proper description formatting for both incomplete and completed tasks.
* Initializes the {@link Deadlines} instances before each test.
* deadline1: Represents an incomplete task with a due date.
* deadline2: Represents a completed task with a due date.
deadline2 = new Deadlines("Submit project", true, LocalDate.of(2024, 10, 15));
* Ensures that the description string generated by the describe method matches
* the expected format for both incomplete and completed deadlines.
assertEquals(expectedDescription1, deadline1.describe(), "Description should match the expected format for incomplete task");
assertEquals(expectedDescription2, deadline2.describe(), "Description should match the expected format for completed task");
* Unit test for the {@link Parser} class.
* This test suite checks the parsing functionality of deadlines
* to ensure valid input is correctly processed without exceptions.
* Tests the {@link Parser#parseDeadline(String)} method with valid input.
* The test checks if the input string "return book /by 2023-12-31" is properly parsed into a task description
* The test expects no exception to be thrown for valid input and asserts that the parsed
* task description and deadline match the expected values.
assertEquals("book", result[0], "The task description should be 'return book'");
fail("Exception should not be thrown for valid input");
* Unit test for the {@link ToDos} class.
* This test suite ensures the correct behavior of the {@link ToDos} constructor
* and includes basic dummy tests for validation.
* A dummy test to demonstrate basic assertion.
* This test checks if the integers 2 and 2 are equal.

* This test checks if the integers 4 and 4 are equal.
* Tests the {@link ToDos} constructor that accepts only the task name.
* This test ensures that the task type is correctly set to 'T', the task name
* is properly initialized, and the task's completion status (`isDone`) is set to false by default.
ToDos todo = new ToDos("Read a book");
assertEquals("Read a book", todo.getName(), "Name should be 'Read a book'");
assertFalse(todo.isDone, "isDone should be false by default");
